com.pump.animation.capture

Class ScreenCapture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.animation.capture.ScreenCapture
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComponentPaintCapture, RobotScreenCapture

    public abstract class ScreenCapture
extends java.lang.Object
    This creates an animation recording the screen.

    This ties into several Java-level components: it uses a RepaintManager and two different AWTEventListeners. Because of this, it is pretty efficient at only capturing/recording what data is appropriate. However it does not capture data that happens outside of Java's control/awareness.

    Note this class is abstract, and it does not actually capture pixels from the screen. That is up to subclasses to implement. The RobotScreenCapture class achieves this using the Robot object, and the ComponentPaintCapture relies on the Component.paint() method. It is also possible to use 3rd parties. For example: when QTJ was still in use, that could be used to capture pixel data from the screen.

    Note this assumes there is only 1 monitor of interest to record from.

      A subdirectory of temp files that is deleted on exit.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenCapture

        public ScreenCapture(java.awt.Rectangle captureBounds)
        Constructs a ScreenCapture object that will record only the rectangle provided.

        captureBounds - the rectangle to record within.

      • ScreenCapture

        public ScreenCapture()

    • Method Detail

      • setTargetedRepaints

        public void setTargetedRepaints(boolean targetedRepaints)
        Control whether this stores only targeted repaints (true) or whether this aggressively repaints everything constantly (false). The default is true.

        This serves as a safety net. Ideally it shouldn't be necessary.

      • getPlaybackRate

        public double getPlaybackRate()
        Return the playback rate. By default this property is 1, but you can accelerate or decelerate it if desired. Note this properties is applied to the entire recording (you can't change it mid-recording and change playback speed for only part of the animation).

      • setPlaybackRate

        public void setPlaybackRate(double playbackRate)
        Set the playback rate. By default this property is 1, but you can accelerate or decelerate it if desired. Note this properties is applied to the entire recording (you can't change it mid-recording and change playback speed for only part of the animation).

      • start

        public void start()
        This begins recording a movie.

      • stop

        public ResettableAnimationReader stop(boolean loop)
        Stops recording the screen content, and returns an animation iterator.
        Parameters:
        loop - true if the animation this returns should loop.

      • capture

        protected abstract java.io.File capture(java.awt.Rectangle r)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This captures a portion of the screen and returns a File representing that image.
        Parameters:
        r - the rectangle to capture
        Returns:
        a file representing the image captured. This should be of a "normal" image format (PNG, JPEG, etc.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
